# Recap: Case studies

\begin{itemize}
  \item Evaluate the analytical strength/relevance of some specified arguments
  \vspace{0.4cm}
  \item Comparative studies v single-case study?
  \vspace{0.4cm}
  \item Additional things to consider
  \vspace{0.1cm}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item Alternative or rival theories?
    \item Alternative methods (interviews, ethnography and archival research)?
    \item Can you combine all of them?
  \end{itemize}
\end{itemize}

# General principles of archival research

\vspace{0.3cm}
\begincols
  \begincol{.4\textwidth}
    \begin{figure}
    \centering
    \includegraphics[scale=0.5]{Figs/history}
    \end{figure}
  \endcol
  \begincol{.5\textwidth}
  \begin{small}
  \begin{itemize}
    \item Be clear about the questions; think through the strategies (induction v deduction)
    \vspace{0.1cm}
    \item Be mindful of the underlying politics of information production, conservation, and declassification
    \vspace{0.1cm}
    \item Be transparent as you are trying to form your interpretations (as well as the selection of details to be reported)
    \vspace{0.1cm}
    \item Be patient and open-minded -- read (and document) as much information as possible; do not jump into conclusion
  \end{itemize}
  \end{small}
  \endcol
\endcols
